name: Rio
focus: Building Rosalind - LLM agents for protein design and biological discovery

project_vision.core_thesis: The next frontier in computational biology is agents that can reason over and interact with interpretable biological world models. Not just better bio FMs, but agents that use mechanistically transparent models to propose experiments, interpret results, and iterate on hypotheses.
project_vision.unique_angle: DNA LMs + mech interp → grounded agents. Use SAE-based interpretability to ground agent reasoning in mechanistic understanding vs pattern matching. This addresses the 33%+ hallucination rates plaguing current scientific agents.
project_vision.critical_gap: No current systems use mech interp to guide agent reasoning in real-time. Most agent systems don't use mechanistic interpretability for grounding - it's post-hoc analysis, not integrated into decision-making loops.
project_vision.connection_to_evo3: Evo 3 is building the biological world model. SAEs on genomic models make it interpretable. Rosalind is the agent layer that uses interpretable features to ground reasoning.
project_vision.workflow_vision: Agent proposes hypothesis → queries DNA LM → uses SAE features to understand WHY the model predicts → validates mechanistic consistency → executes → learns from results. Creates feedback loop: better interpretability → better grounded agents → better science.
project_vision.inspiration: Arc + Goodfire already built SAE-based interpretability tools for Evo 2. This validates the direction. We're extending it to agent decision-making.

decisions.decision: Chose attention head screening workflow over single-pass tasks (contact prediction, structure prediction)
decisions.rationale: Agents excel at multi-step exploration, not single forward passes. Screening workflow requires iterative analysis (which heads? which patterns?), comparison across clusters, and decision-making (which is most promising?). This leverages agent capabilities.

decisions.decision: Focus first workflow on protein-DNA interactions, not protein structure
decisions.rationale: Protein-DNA interactions (transposase→TIRs) are less saturated than structure prediction. Attention heads might reveal binding patterns that MSA misses. More aligned with discovery angle than benchmarking.

decisions.decision: Use Gwanggyu's IS element data as test case for first workflow
decisions.rationale: Perfect dataset: related sequences (same transposase family), known biology (TIRs, target sites), clear protein-DNA interactions. Multiple clusters enable screening/ranking approach.

decisions.decision: Built decorator-based tool system for Rosalind SDK
decisions.rationale: Decorator pattern makes it trivial to register functions as agent tools - just @tool decorator. Automatic schema generation from type hints and docstrings means no manual tool definition boilerplate. Critical for rapid iteration when adding bio FM tools.

decisions.decision: Used Typer + Rich for CLI instead of raw argparse
decisions.rationale: Typer provides modern, type-safe CLI with automatic help generation. Rich adds beautiful terminal UI (colors, spinners, formatting) which matters for scientific workflows where agents may take time to reason.

Most capable model for complex scientific reasoning. 1M token context window enables working with large genomic sequences and research papers. Worth the cost ($5/$25 per million tokens) for protein design applications.

decisions.decision: Implemented tool calling loop directly in agent class, not external orchestrator
decisions.rationale: Keeps agent logic self-contained. Tool use → execution → result formatting is core agent behavior, shouldn't be separated. Simplifies debugging and makes agent behavior more transparent.

decisions.decision: Used `marked` library for markdown parsing over heavier alternatives like react-markdown
decisions.rationale: Lightweight (~40KB gzipped vs. ~150KB), simple API suitable for basic markdown rendering needs

decisions.decision: Used Vite's import.meta.glob for loading markdown files
decisions.rationale: Enables static analysis at build time for optimal bundling and automatically handles file watching in dev mode

decisions.decision: Implemented isolated dark mode for stream page only
decisions.rationale: Stream is conceptually separate - a hidden personal space. Maintains site's warm, inviting aesthetic for public pages without state management complexity

decisions.decision: Used manual sync script instead of automated file watcher
decisions.rationale: Personal stream doesn't require real-time updates, manual sync gives control over what gets published, avoids complexity of file watchers and build hooks

decisions.decision: Used navigate(-1) for back navigation instead of hardcoded route
decisions.rationale: More flexible - works if user navigates to stream from any page, not just homepage

learnings.learning: IS elements (insertion sequences) are mobile genetic elements with transposase genes flanked by terminal inverted repeats (TIRs). Transposase binds to TIRs for transposition - clear protein-DNA interaction.
learnings.context: Exploring Gwanggyu's data for first Rosalind workflow - understanding the biology behind the test case

learnings.learning: Attention heads in genomic LMs might capture long-range interactions (like TIRs at sequence ends) that MSA-based methods miss, especially for divergent sequences with low conservation.
learnings.context: Discussing why attention heads could reveal protein-DNA binding patterns better than traditional alignment

learnings.learning: Screening/ranking approach (comparing multiple datasets to find best one) is more valuable than benchmarking (comparing methods on fixed dataset). Guides where to focus experimental validation.
learnings.context: Designing first workflow - realized screening provides actionable output (which system to study) vs just method comparison

learnings.learning: Anthropic tool schema format: Uses JSON Schema for input_schema with type, properties, required fields. Must extract from Python function signatures using inspect module.
learnings.context: Building tool decorator for Rosalind - need to convert Python functions to Anthropic's expected format for tool use

learnings.learning: Tool calling loop pattern: Must maintain message history with tool_use blocks and tool_result blocks. Continue loop until response contains text block without tool_use.
learnings.context: Implementing RosalindAgent.chat() - critical to handle multi-step tool use correctly

learnings.learning: Python-dotenv must be loaded explicitly: Use load_dotenv() at module import to read .env files. Environment variables aren't automatically loaded.
learnings.context: Configuration management for API keys - prevent users from manually exporting env vars

learnings.learning: pyproject.toml [project.scripts] creates CLI entry points: Mapping 'rosalind = rosalind.cli:app' makes the command available after pip install
learnings.context: Setting up CLI - modern Python packaging replaces old setup.py console_scripts

learnings.learning: Remote cluster work requires SSH wrapping: All file reads, writes, and commands must be executed via 'ssh host "cd path && command"' pattern
learnings.context: Building on chimera-login cluster - learned importance of proper SSH command structure for remote development

learnings.learning: Body background management: Must store original document.body.style.backgroundColor value before modification to ensure proper cleanup
learnings.context: Implemented dark mode isolation for stream page - critical for preventing style bleed to other pages

learnings.learning: Keyboard event context handling: Check e.target.tagName to prevent shortcuts from triggering when users are typing in form fields
learnings.context: Implemented 's' keyboard shortcut - discovered importance of context detection for good UX

learnings.learning: Vite import glob syntax: The query: '?raw' parameter is essential for loading markdown files as raw strings
learnings.context: Loading markdown files with import.meta.glob - without ?raw, Vite attempts to parse them as modules

learnings.learning: Timestamp parsing from filenames: RegEx pattern /(\d{4})-(\d{2})-(\d{2})-(\d{2})(\d{2})\.md$/ cleanly extracts date components
learnings.context: Implemented filename-based timestamp extraction for stream entries

learnings.learning: Animation staggering: Using delay: index * 0.05 in Framer Motion creates pleasing cascading effect
learnings.context: Implemented entry animations for stream page - small delay multiplier prevents overwhelming simultaneous animations

learnings.learning: PI strongly prefers minimal, scannable documentation. Reduced README from 538 to 146 lines (73% reduction) - removed verbose explanations, kept only essential info (what, how to install, basic usage).
learnings.context: Condensed Rosalind README per PI request ('readme is just too long'). This aligns with broader taste for minimalism seen across other projects.

context.project_state: Built Rosalind SDK foundation (task 11). Cleaned up README to be much more scannable (task 13). Identified first workflow: attention head screening tool for protein-DNA interactions. Will process IS element clusters (transposase sequences from Gwanggyu's data) to find which shows strongest protein→DNA attention signals. Agent will rank clusters and identify most promising for studying transposase-TIR binding.

conversations.summary: Brainstormed first Rosalind workflow. Rejected single-pass tasks (contact prediction) in favor of multi-step agent workflow. Decided on attention head screening: process multiple IS element clusters to find which shows strongest protein-DNA interaction signals for downstream study.
key_topics: IS element data structure and biology
action_items: Process IS element clusters (IS3_tnp, IS21_tnp, etc.)
Identify most promising cluster for validation
new_learnings: Single-pass tasks (contact prediction) don't leverage agent capabilities - need multi-step exploration
Attention heads from genomic LMs might capture protein-DNA binding patterns (transposase→TIRs)
IS elements are good test case: related sequences, known biology, protein-DNA interactions
Screening approach (ranking clusters) more valuable than benchmarking on single dataset

task_history.title: Set Up Rosalind Agent SDK and CLI
